## {#rstudio-appearance data-menu-title="RStudio Appearance"}

[`r fontawesome::fa("palette", fill = "#05859B", a11y = "sem")` RStudio Appearance]{.slide-title}

<span style = 'font-size: 60%;'>Change the appearance of RStudio by choosing **Tools** > **Global Options** > **Appearance** and try out different options from the **Editor font**, **Editor font size**, and **Editor theme** drop downs.</span>

<center><img src="media/pics/appearance.png" alt="" width="700"/></center>

---

## {#pane-layout data-menu-title="Pane Layout"}

[`r fontawesome::fa("th-large", fill = "#05859B", a11y = "sem")` Rearrange Pane Layout]{.slide-title}

<span style = 'font-size: 75%;'>Change the pane layout (and add additional panes!) by choosing **Tools** > **Global Options** > **Pane Layout** and select what you would like in each RStudio quadrant.</span>

<center><img src="media/pics/panels.png" alt="" width="700"/></center>

## {#soft-wrap-rainbows data-menu-title="Soft wrap & rainbows"}

[Soft wrap long lines & `r fontawesome::fa("rainbow", fill = "#05859B", a11y = "sem")` rainbow parentheses]{.slide-title}

<span style = 'font-size: 60%;'>*Soft wrap long lines* to make all code/text visible, even on a small window. Enable *rainbow parentheses* to easily identify matching opening/closing parentheses.</span>

## {#enable-soft-wrap-rainbows data-menu-title="Enable soft wrap & rainbows"}

[Soft wrap long lines & `r fontawesome::fa("rainbow", fill = "#05859B", a11y = "sem")` rainbow parentheses]{.slide-title}

<span style = 'font-size: 60%;'>Enable soft wrap and rainbow parentheses by choosing **Code** -> **Soft Wrap Long Lines** and **Rainbow parentheses** from the top menu bar.</span>

<center><img src="media/pics/enable_rainbow_wrap.png" alt="" width="700"/></center>

## {#code-folding data-menu-title="Code folding"}

[`r fontawesome::fa("eye-slash", fill = "#05859B", a11y = "sem")` Code folding
]{.slide-title}

<span style = 'font-size: 50%;'>Any comment line which includes at least 4 trailing `-`, `=`, or `#` automatically creates a code section. You can read more about code folding [here](https://support.rstudio.com/hc/en-us/articles/200484568-Code-Folding-and-Sections-in-the-RStudio-IDE). Also check out the [{ARTofR}](https://github.com/Hzhang-ouce/ARTofR) package for creating fancier code sections!</span>

::: {.panel-tabset}

## {#multiple-sessions data-menu-title="Multiple RStudio Sessions"}

[`r fontawesome::fa("plus", fill = "#05859B", a11y = "sem")` Open multiple RStudio sessions]{.slide-title}

<span style = 'font-size: 75%;'>You may have more than one RStudio session (i.e. R project) open at a time. Click on your currently-open project at the top right corner of RStudio. Choose either ***Open Project in New Session...*** to browse all of your R projects, or click on the ***new window*** icon next to one of your more recently opened projects. Doing so will pop open an additional RStudio window with that project.</span>

<center><img src="media/pics/new_session.png" alt="" width="700"/></center>

---

[`r fontawesome::fa("stop-circle", fill = "#05859B", a11y = "sem")` Change console output limit]{.slide-title}
